full on off. Drilled to wide long on

umpire raises his finger! We're going upstairs because it could be an lbw or a caught dismissal. Full outside off, and he tries to paddle a fine sweep. Takes his front leg across, but he misses the shot. The ball turns sharply, misses the front leg, and hits the back leg before going in the air. The fielder at first slip anticipates the shot and runs behind the keeper to his left, and takes the catch after it pops up from the back leg. The fielders appeal in unison for caught and given. Liton reviews the decision but the TV umpire says that the ball has hit his bat before hitting his leg. Clean catch by first slip, so Liton has to go. Anticipation at its best
full, on off stump. Defended
dropped! Cornwall has to wait for his five-for. Fullish, just outside off. Defends with no feet movement, takes the outside edge but Blackwood drops it

Blackwood makes amends! Holds on to this edged shot this time, and Cornwall has his five! Good length ball outside off. Angling in. Tries to defend off the front foot, but takes the edge, and the fielder takes a sharp catch moving to his right
length ball on off and angling into the left-hander. Worked to the leg side
good length, outside off from around the stumps. Angling in, and nudged behind square
good length, on middle and leg. Fends it with soft hands, on the ground. Goes past short leg
back of a length, just outside off stump. He shoulders his arms

Gabriel wins the battle agaisnt Mehidy! Fullish, on middle and off. He pushes at this, rather tentatively, and it's gone to he fielder at cover for a soft dismissal! Has Gabriel overstepped though? No! Fair ball. Mehidy has to go for 57
dug in short, from around the wicket, and angling across him, and he leaves
fuller, around leg, and dug out by Jayed
length, tossed up, and he drives. Through the slips cordon towards third man
presses forward to defend
fired a tad quick, but down the leg side. Off Da Silva's pads as he swivels across to stop it
presses forward and defends well
shorter in length, and he goes back to cut this away towards third man. Well placed, keeping it away from that gully
length, and he works this off the stumps towards square leg, and keeps the strike for the next over
length, just outside off, and he plays inside the line of this as he shapes to defend

full, and he looks to whip this away. Dropped at short mid-wicket! Was a regulation catch to Brathwaite, and he probably took it a bit too easy. Was at a comfortable height, around his chest. Probably just got caught between going with his palms facing downwards, or going for the reverse cup
hops to negotiate a shorter ball
fullish length, and he taps this towards mid-on. The man is a touch wide, and they scamper through for a single
length, wide outside off, bowled at 134.8 kph, and Jayed leaves
length, around off, moving back in. He defends. It drops towards mid-off, and Jayed comes a few steps down looking for the single, but Taijul wants to retain strike at the other end
length, works it away through his pads towards deep backward square leg. Takes the single, that brings no.11 on strike
length, presses forward to defend. Off the edge, but towards point, and they hurry through for a single
down the wicket, and lofted through the mid-wicket region. Gabriel gets across from mid-on to stop it
defends one around leg stump

missed stumping chance! Was it also a drop? A good length ball outside off, and he looks for the drive. Goes to Da Silva, and just pops out of his glove. Had he collected properly, may have been a stumping chance, even if that didn't take the outside edge. So much happening whenever Cornwall bowls!
driven back to the bowler
down the leg side, and he leaves
length, around off, defended
short of a length, cramping him for room. Deemed a wide, because it bounced way over him
length, jags back in from outside off, and strikes him on the pad. Sliding down leg, though there's a big appeal initially. No review taken. Perhaps an inside edge as well on it
back of a length, outside off, left alone

this has lifted off a length, and been taken at gully! Banged in with purpose by Joseph, and Jayed was poised to try and go forward, but ended up being surprised by the pace. Was on the hop as he hoped to negotiate it, but ended up playing it off the shoulder of the bat towards gully. West Indies are overjoyed with this effort, as they wind up with a 113-run lead
length, outside off, spins away just a touch. Left alone
length, a bit of bounce as it spins across him. He stretches forward and blocks it
flat, but short, and he goes back and across to pull this away. Great intent in that shot
fuller, outside off, left alone. Just seemed to keep a touch low
length, around off, and he stretches forward to defend
length, around off, turns away, and he leaves
length, and he goes back to pull this. Off the inside edge, on to his pad, and drops on the off side
wide of off, and he goes through the deep point region towards the sweeper out in the deep
length, and he goes back and drives this towards deep point
length, around off, and he goes back to punch this towards mid-off
length, goes back and pushes this towards mid-on. Quick single taken, with some great running
length, hangs back and defends with the turn towards short mid-wicket
length, fired in a touch quicker, and he hangs back to whip this away towards mid-wicket
works it with the turn towards deep mid-wicket
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press. Plays it away towards backward point
flatter, and he goes back and punches this to the sweeper at point
length, and he goes back to punch this towards long-on
fuller, around off, and he presses forward to smother this
length, around the pads, and he can go back and across, and work this away through the mid-wicket region to the sweeper on the on side
fuller, driven with the turn, straight towards short mid-wicket

short, and he looks to go back and whip this away. It's an appeal for caught behind, and wasn't given. Bangladesh have reviewed immediately! If he gets a wicket for this, he will consider himself a really lucky man. That was a really poor ball. Brathwaite has got a little tickle off the glove. In fact, off the little finger on his bottom hand. That is really unlucky, but a superb take by Liton Das!
presses forward to defend a length ball around off. Massive stride forward, which is good to see
straighter, and a crisp connection takes it wide of mid-on. Easy single
length, and he goes back to cut this away towards deep backward point
length, around off, and he defends
length, straightens from outside off, and he goes back to defend towards square leg
length, outside off, and he defends
length, goes back to play this. Sharp turn, but not very quick, and it strikes him on the bat as he shapes to defend. Could have been a close contender for leg before had he missed
works this with the turn towards short mid-wicket
fuller, and he is happy to go back and defend on the on side
length, a bit of lift as it turns across, and he defends
floated more around the pads, and he works this away through mid-wicket. There's no sweeper for the batsmen now, so they come back for two, before mid-on goes across to stop it
oresses forward to defend one around off
length, presses forward to defend one around off
presses forward to defend a length ball, outside off
hangs back and punches this towards sweeper cover
presses forward to drive a length ball around off. Off his pads towards slip. Two appeals, perhaps both for lbw and for caught at slip, but neither upheld
hangs back and allows this to spin back in from outside off
length, around off, turns back in, and he goes back to defend
closer to him, and he can drive this with some conviction. Wide of mid-on, and easy two runs accepted by the batsmen
length, outside off, and he drives this towards cover. A diving stop, but cannot prevent the single
length, and he goes back to defend one turning back into him from outside off
length, turns across him from outside off, and goes past the outside edge, as he stretches forward to defend
fired in quick. Strikes him on the pad as he stretches forward to defend. Surely going down leg. They appeal, and then think about a review, but decide against it
length, and he goes back to defend
presses forward to defend one
flatter, quicker, and he goes back to defend. Off the bottom of the bat, and down on to the ground just near his foot
length, and he goes back to cut, but cannot make contact as it spins and bounces a touch extra
length, nurdled away towards point. Taijul pounces on the ball and has a shy at the non-striker's end, seeing the batsmen were keen to get a single going
hangs back and guides this with the turn to the right of point

that's the 100th Test wicket for Miraz. Just tosses this up a touch fuller, and Moseley plays a forward defence. It bounces, spins a bit, and flies through to second slip. Miraz has got to that mark the quickest, among Shakib Al Hasan, Taijul Islam and Mohammad Rafique. You will also notice that he's the first off-spinner. Indeed the first who doesn't bowl left-arm orthodox!
sharp turn from around the wicket to new man Nkrumah Bonner. Squares him up a bit in defence, and he's able to run it away with soft hands towards third man
length, and he goes back to defend this
length, and he goes back to work this towards square leg
length, fired in a touch quick, and he defends from the crease
tosses this up, and he stretches forward to drive it back to the bowler
length, and he goes back and punches this towards sweeper cover
length, outside off, and he goes back to block this with a dead bat
length, works this with the turn towards short mid-wicket
length, goes back and defends it as it spins back into him
length, goes back and defends this after it spins from outside off
length, turn from outside off, and beats the outside edge, as Campbell stretches to defend
fuller, outside off, and he leaves after having a close look at it
a bit more effort put into this, but ends up bowling straighter. He can go back and work this away through mid-wicket
goes wide of the crease, from around the wicket, and spears this in a touch fuller. Driven to cover
bowled from a little further behind the crease, angles into him from around leg and middle, and he just eases this through the gap between square leg and mid-wicket. That's timing and a half!
length, around leg, and straightens. Defended from the crease
fuller, around the pads. He looks to whip this away, but it strikes his pad
length, and he stretches to drive. Cannot beat short cover
short, and he goes back and swats this, but cannot beat short cover
length, and he can shuffle across and work this towards mid-wicket. Fielded by mid-on, running ot his left
sharp turn, and bounce, from around middle and off, across Bonner, who leaves
fuller, and he looks to swat this towards long-on. Spins across him, and beats his outside edge
length, and he goes back to punch this to mid-on

works this towards mid-on, from where Rahim comes swopping in and strikes the base of the stumps. Campbell was a bit lazy with grounding the bat, but seems to have made it. They also pinched an overthrow with the ricochet going to the off side. It stays not out!
fired in quick, and he goes back to defend. Loud appeal for leg before, but Liton seems to indicate to him that this has hit bat
goes back to defend a quicker one
length, goes back and punches towards cover
length, around off, defended towards short mid-wicket
fuller, around off, and driven back towards the bowler
length, and he goes back to defend this
length, defended from the crease, after covering the line from outside off

short in length, and he looks to take pull this away. Seems to have taken pad on the way through to leg slip. For a moment, memories of the Brathwaite wicket would have come back flashing in front of Bangladesh eyes. But they don't review this one
defends one that is pushed through a bit quicker
length, around off, and he defends
short, and he can go back and pull this away towards deep mid-wicket. There's a sweeper, but quite square. They can pick up the second
worked with the spin towards square leg, off the back foot
fuller, driven past short mid-wicket with the spin
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, spins away across him from outside off, and he leaves. A shadow practice of a drive, but after the ball is collected by Liton Das
fuller length, straight in line, driven back towards the bowler
length, sharp turn from outside off, and he goes back to defend this
length, worked with the turn towards deep mid-wicket. A misfield from Mushfiqur Rahim at short mid-wicket
length, goes back to defend. This keeps a tad low, but the pace on it allows Campbell to adjust and drive towards mid-wicket
superb bowling! Tossed up, whizzes past his outside edge, after drifting in a bit. Campbell was stretching to defend, and was beaten all ends up
just a bit short, enough for him to go back and drive towards deep point
length, around off, and he goes back to cover the line and block
length, and he goes back to defend. Off the outer part of the bat, but with soft hands, towards third man. Two picked before deep point can get across to it
goes back to this. Surprised by the lack of turn this time but there was bounce, but he had covered the line. Went between his legs off, past the inside edge

oh dear, there's the third for Bangladesh! He's gone back to play another one. It's spun back in, taken the inside edge, bounced inside the crease, and then just gone on to disturb the top of leg stump. Campbell just cannot catch a break, can he?
fired in straighter, and he defends with a little forward press
driven back towards the bowler
length, works this with the turn towards short mid-wicket
length, goes back to defend
short, down the leg side. He wants to whip it away, but misses out
length, takes the inside edge as he looks to drive. On to his own pads, but there's no silly point. Drops in front of slip
drives with the turn towards short mid-wicket
length, and he goes back to defend this
fuller length, driven towards mid-on, and they scamper a single to take Warrican off strike
length, around off, and he stretches forward to defend
fired in a touch quick, around leg and middle, and he defends from the crease
fuller, around leg and middle, stretches forward to defend
stretches forward to defend one
presses forward to smother one around off
length, around off, and Warrican defends after getting behind the line
fuller, looks to drive. Off the inner edge, towards short mid-wicket
length, presses forward to defend. Pitched around off, spinning back in
length, and he goes back to defend it
length, presses forward to defend
length, played off the edge, and just beyond slip. They take the single on offer. How close was that to Soumya Sarkar?
length, defended with a forward press
fired in a touch quicker, but he blocks with a little forward press
smothers one with a little forward press
flighted closer to him, around off and middle, and he stretches to defend this
length, presses forward to defend. Beats the inside edge and cannons into his pads. Going down leg, despite a massive appeal
tossed up around leg, and worked away with a defensive push towards short mid-wicket
short in length, angles in, and he goes back to pull this towards deep mid-wicket. Some good running before deep square leg can get across to it
short, wide, and swatted towards extra cover. Deep point will get across to it
defends a length ball around off
full, but down the pads, and he has worked this away towards deep backward square leg. Easy two again
length, defends one slanting back into him
defends this with soft hands towards point and sets off. Warrican rushes through to the striker's end, but the fielder from cover cannot collect anyway, as he shapes to underarm this
length, around off, spinning away, and he leaves. Seems to have left his bat hanging though
more assured this time, as he takes his bat out of the way of one pitching around off and spinning away
length, slow turn, and he goes back to punch it towards backward point
fuller, and he drives this towards cover
presses forward and he defends
length, presses forward to defend that
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
fuller, just a touch wide of off, and beats the outside edge, as Warrican has a waft at that. No real feet movement
length, allows this to strike the outer part of the bat, but played with soft hands. Goes away towards gully
length, around leg, and he defends with a little forward press
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
length, a hint of swing away from outside off, and he shoulders arms
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend. Decent turn, but slow, and he is able to block it towards the off side
fuller, driven towards wide cover
length, and he stretches forward to defend one around leg and middle
length, presses forward to defend one
goes back and punches this towards deep point. Sweeper from extra cover gets around to his left, but they come back for the second
fired in a touch quicker, and he defends from the crease. Line was leg and middle

length ball, around off, jags back a touch, and has struck him on the pads. Given out leg before, and they decide against the review. Perhaps the question would have been about both line and height, but both look pretty good at first sight. Unless Warrican thinks he had edged it, but he is convinced that's not the case. Jayed strikes, and even if it is the nightwatchman, it has an opening for Bangladesh
just a bit short, and he whips this off the back foot to the left of mid-on. Nothing more than a push, but placed to perfection
back of a length, punched to mid-on this time
fuller, outside off, and left alone
fuller, and he looks to leave this. It gets some excess bounce, and goes off the toe of the bat as he shapes to take it out of the way. Nurdles away towards gully

fuller, and he presses forward to defend. That has beaten him all ends up. Bangladesh are excited, but that's probably the bat hitting pad. Bangladesh think about a review, but decide against it. Wise, I think
flatter, but along the leg and middle line. He presses forward to block this towards the on side. Wants a quick single, but gets no support from the other end
length, outside off, and he defends
around off, defended with a forward press
stretches forward to meet one outside off
presses forward and finds one fired in a touch quicker. Off the inside edge, and goes away towards fine leg
stretches forward to defend one
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he defends as it angles back into him
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press
uppish, but just past gully! This was a touch fuller, and just swung away a bit. Bonner was looking to go square, but it goes off the edge, and runs away to deep backward point
wide of the crease, bowled at 124 kph, angles in, and he defends after covering the line
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
a touch shorter, and allows him to go back and punch this wide of cover, towards mid-off. Easy single
length, cut away towards point
tossed up, and he looks to drive. Spins away across his outside edge, with good bounce
flatter, and he goes back to punch this wide of cover
fuller length, and he presses forward to defend it right under his nose
length, worked away with the angle towards short mid-wicket with a defensive push
goes for the yorker. Ends up with a gentle full toss, at about 125.7 kph, and he drives it to mid-off
length, and he defends this with a forward press
length, and he presses forward to defend. This angled in from around off
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
defends a length ball around off
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
goes back to defend one turning back in
whips a fuller ball towards short mid-wicket
presses forward to smother one around middle
length, quicker through the air at 89 kph, and he has to go back and adjust his bat to defend one spinning back in
defends with a forward press, and ends up getting it towards deep point

length, gets it to jag back at him. Mayers is stuck in the crease. And this is given out. He has reviewed, though! Looks pretty adjacent. Just falls over a ball that was angling in. Bat got stuck in behind the pad, and the height is perfect as well. This should reflect three reds. In fact, it stays umpire's call on wickets, as it just grazes the top of leg stump. But Bangladesh will take that. Big wicket, considering his Chattogram heroics. Jayed has just reward
length, around off, and he drives this towards cover. A hint of reverse swing for Jayed
length, gets squared up a touch in defence. Played towards point
oh, glorious! It's a fullish delivery, and he just leans into it, and drives it on the up...all the way over long-on. That has to be one of the shots of the match, and there have been a few!
short, and he looks to drive off the back foot. Periliously close to cover, where Najmul Hossain Shanto sees this drop just short of him, low to his left
length, angles in, and he works it off his hips towards long leg
length, around off, defended with a forward press
punches one through cover. There's a wide long-off in place for Blackwood
fired quick, and a touch wide, and left alone
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, around off, and he defends at full stretch
strays to the pads, and he can work this away towards square leg
length, outside off, and he leaves. A bit of shape away from the bat, but this looks more like conventional swing
length, and he defends with a little forward press
length, outside off, swings away, and he leaves
length, dropped towards cover-point and they sneak in a single
fuller, and he drives towards long on
length, angles in from around off, a hint of reverse swing, as he blocks this
full outside off. Turning away after pitching. Tries to drive and misses

appeal for stumping! And Liton is convinced. The batsman holds his pose, wondering if his foot was back in. Full outside off. He tries to drive, but the ball goes through. Liton grabs and whips the bails off well, and the batsman's back leg is outside the line, just about. No part of his boot is inside, says the TV umpire. He's got to go!
full, just outside off. Turning away. Liton collects
full, on off stump. Lunges forward to defend
full on off stump. Defended back to the bowler
fullish, on off stump. Defended back
tosses it up, outside off stump. Drives to extra cover
good length, just outside off. Turning in, and fended off the back foot to the leg side
good length, just outside off. Turning in, and fended off the back foot to the leg side
fullish, wide. Sticks his leg out and pads it away
length ball, on middle. Turning into leg. Nudged off his pads to square leg

appeal for caught but a soft shout. Length ball, on middle. Angling into him, and he tries to flick. Hits the body, pops in the air, backward short leg catches. Umpire says not out but Bangladesh review, and that's a wasted one because the bat/glove is nowhere near the ball
full outside off stump. Defended, with soft hands, past silly mid off
full, slightly wide outside off. Turning away further. Left alone
full on middle and off. Giant stride forward, and blocked
full on middle. Down on one knee and smothers a sweep against the turn to deep backward square for four
good length, on middle. Goes onto the back foot and flicks to deep midwicket
full outside off, delivering it from the wide of the crease. Tries to defend off the front foot, but the ball whizzes past his edge and to the keeper
fullish, on off. Turning into him. Defended off the back foot to the leg side
full, on middle. Faster delivery, flatter. Blocked off the back foot
slower, full outside off. Blocks with the full face of the bat
full, flat, and landing just outside off. Comfortably blocked off the back foot
ooo, nearly onto the stumps! Fullish, just outside off and turning in. Looks to defend off the back foot, and it hits his body. Nearly falls on top of leg stump
length ball on off. Turning in, and he looks to defend. Hits the back leg, but too high
full on middle. Tries to defend off the front foot. Ball flies off the edge to Mominul at silly point, who dives to his right. Just past him. Bangladesh think that could've been a wicket

Bonner's swinging against the turn but misses. Full on off, and he tries to hammer this behind square on the leg side after going down on one knee. Through to the keeper after brushing his pad. They don't appeal for lbw or the stumping.
good length on off, and skidding in. Goes onto the back foot to defend
full on middle and leg. Lunges forward to defend
good length on off. He goes onto the back foot, and punches a shot to deep point with the bat's open face
good length, on off. Fended after going deep inside the crease, and onto the back foot
full on off. Flicked with the turn towards wide mid on
full, slightly wide outside off. Defended off the front foot, back to Nayeem
fullish, just outside off. Turning in. Blocked off the back foot
full, on middle and leg. Flicked off his pads to midwicket
full, on off. Clears the front leg, and deposits a shot to the vacant cow-corner region! Against the run of play
good length, outside off. Stays low, turns in. Da Silva gets on the back foot and drags a flick to deep midwicket
slower in the air. Drifting into middle, turning away thereafter. Da Silva wants to defend, but it goes past, and hits his shoulder
full, on off. Presses forward to defend. Inside-edged onto his pad
short ball, on off. Goes deep and cuts in front of square to the sweeper-fielder on the off side
misses the cut. Wants to find the gap behind square but the length ball turns a bit too much away. Bonner was in two minds there
full, on off and turning a bit away. Big stride forward to defend
full on middle. Blocked with soft hands off the front foot
overpitched, outside off, and he comes forward to play an elegant cover drive. Fielder at short cover dives to his left but can't intercept
full on off stump. Defended back off the front foot
full on leg, and flicked comfortably off his boots behind square. Lead now approaching 210!
fullish, just outside off. Nudged towards point with the ball staying low
full outside off in the fifth-stump channel. Shoulders his arms
full, on off. Pushed with the bat at a 45-degree angle. Towards cover
full, outside off. Massive turn away. Liton takes it from near the tram lines
full, on off. Pushed to cover point for a quick run. Da Silva a bit late to take off, and although Liton whips the bails off swiftly, he is probably safe. TV umpire checks nonetheless
full on off. Pushed with soft hands towards silly mid off
good length, outside off. Rocks back and cuts to deep point
full on middle. Defended with the full face of the bat
fullish, on off stump. Defended with soft hands
full, almost a yorker. Dug away as he toe-ends a drive to mid off
fullish, just outside off stump. Taps it off the back foot to the bowler
fullish, just outside off stump. Defended
full just outside off. Ball stays low, and goes through to the keeper
fullish, on off. Angling slightly in, and blocked away for a maiden over
good length, just outside leg and coming into the stumps. Fended back to the bowler
full, on off. Flicks, with poor timing, to midwicket
good length, on middle. Turning into his pads, and guided to square leg
full, on off stump. Defends it off the front foot towards cover
good length, on middle, and turning into leg. Backs away to cut but can't because it's too close to his body
fullish, on middle. Punched off the back foot to midwicket, but no single
full on middle stump. Moving inwards, and pushed towards mid on after shuffling across the stumps
full, on off. Searing in, and comfortably check-driven to mid on
good length, just outside off. Opens the bat's face to guide it to point
fullish, just outside off. Shuffles across to cover his stumps, and then shoulders his arms
driven to mid on
fullish, just outside off stump. Tapped with soft hands
works it leg side, and they take off right away for a single. Chance of a run out, but Da Silva is well in
full outside off stump. Turning in, and whipped to short midwicket
full on off. Worked towards the non-striker
full outside off. Pushed back to Mehidy, who moves to his right to intercept
length ball on middle. Turning into his pads, worked to square leg
good length, outside off and turning into off. Dead-batted
full, on off. Turning slightly away. Defended
fullish, on off. Defended off the back foot, with soft hands
full outside off stump. Clears the front leg and hammers a drive to the off side. Protection there though
full, just outside off stump. Defended, after stretching forward
fullish, on off stump. Blocked away
full outside off stump, left alone
length, turns in from around leg and middle, and it spins down the leg side. Took the thigh pad, but he isn't offering a shot, and so they don't run as it pulls up ahead of the fine leg boundary
turns more, but is short, and he can go back and swing this away towards long leg. There's a backward square leg in place, but this evades him
length, hangs back to defend towards the on side
length, hangs back and defends this after it turns back into him
length ball, and he goes back to access this again. Spinning down leg, and he swings just like the second ball of the over, but cannot beat square leg this time
drives, coming forward to get it down to long-on
presses forward to smother a length ball around off
short of a length, and he goes back to drive this towards sweeper cover

there's the wicket! Da Silva is forced into just planting his bat with a forward press, as the ball is flighted around off. It turns, takes the edge, and goes straight to slip. Underwhelming celebrations, because the home side realise this pitch is now offering some more grip and bounce than the previous few days
strays a bit straighter, and he can drive this towards deep mid-on
length, presses forward to defend
length, and he goes back to whip it away towards short mid-wicket
fuller, driven back down the ground. Bonner has to quickly step out of the way at the non-striker's end, but it strikes his hip and goes towards long-on. They pick up the two
drives a length ball back, uppishly, but just short of the bowler to his right
length, and he goes back to defend this compactly
presses forward to defend one around off
fuller, around off, and he stretches forward to defend this

that's in the slot, and he has cleared cow corner! Tossed up, closer to him, and we know from past experience that Joseph doesn't mind taking on the deep midwicket fieldsman. Easy clearance over his head
just a bit short, and he can go back and cut this towards deep backward point. They want the second, but Joseph refuses, as Mushfiqur was quick to converge on the ball from deep point

off the leading edge, and picked up after a deflection off silly mid-off! Tossed up by Taijul, and he was looking to close the face on this. Went off the edge, and took a deflection off the leg of silly mid-off, and flew comfortably along to short cover
length, and he dobbles this over the top. Doesn't go a long way, and drops just wide of extra cover. Cover and mid-off get to the ball, but only after it drops on the field
drives with the turn towards extra cover
tossed up, on a length, but he is happy this time to block after going back
length, spins and bounces from around off, and Cornwall watchfully taps it right in front

Bonner goes for the reverse, but is bowled! Tossed up by Nayeem, outside off, and he gets into a really awkward position. Possibly looking for the reverse swat, but that goes through his legs and disturbs the furniture. His vigil comes to an anti-climactic end
full, just outside off. Defended towards the off side
good length, on off. Flicks behind square to deep backward square
full, on off. Defended with the turn with soft hands

taken at deep midwicket! Full, just outside off, and he goes for the big slog onto the leg side. In the air for ages, but Mushfiqur dives near the boundary line to take the catch. Bangladesh need 231 to win
full, from around the stumps on off. Defended
full, on off. Lunges forward to defend
full outside off. Skips down the ground and pushes it past the bowler's right to long off
good length, just outside off. Turning a bit away. Tapped towards cover
full outside off. Turning away. Left alone
full, on his pads. Flicked fine, to the leg side, with the fielder giving it a chase
good length on off. Seams in a bit. He looks to defend close to his body, and it hits the bat's face and rolls away to third man for four
full, on middle and leg. Flicked with the swing to deep backward square leg
full on middle. Presses forward and plays the drive with the bat's closed face. Between midwicket and mid on this time
fullish, on middle. Angles past the outside edge as he misses making contact via the front-foot defense. Through to Da Silva, but he has to jump to collect it. Extra bounce!
full, on middle and leg. Defends off the front foot, to mid on
full on off and angling away. Left alone
full, big stride forward to defend
flatter ball, lands outside off and angles back. Punched straight to Cornwall, but misfield by the bowler allows Sarkar to get off the mark
good length, on middle. Goes onto the back foot and flicks to square leg
good length, just outside off stump. Rocks back, blocks off the back foot
fullish, just outside off stump. Left alone
full and wide outside off. Angling further away and Tamim presses forward and plays a beautiful square drive past the fielder lurking at deep point
full, on his toes and flicked off his toes, behind square, and this is eight runs off two balls
wants to guide this ball outside leg stump, but misses making the connection
defends this good length ball off the back foot
tapped away to the off side
full, just outside off. Crunches a drive, but finds cover
down the wicket, and a good shot. Inside out, as Cornwall throws this a touch wider. He doesn't bother with keeping it down, with no fielder beyond cover
closer to him, and he defends
flatter, around off, and he defends with a forward press
floated wide of off, and he leaves this
defends one closer to him
flatter, and he goes back to defend
short, into his body, and he defends this towards point and they pick up a quick single
full, on the pads, and worked away towards deep square leg. Beautiful balance and timing on this shot, especially with a short leg in place
short, and he defends with a little hop, playing it to point
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
dug in short, outside off, and he weaves out of the way
fuller, straighter, and he defends
skips down the wicket, smothers a length ball around off
goes back and works this away with the incoming slant towards deep backward square leg
fuller, defends with a forward press
fuller, defends with a forward press
length, goes back to punch this to short mid-wicket
tossed up, and he stretches to defend
wide of the crease, fullish length, driven towards short cover
short, cut away, but there's a deep point place now
fullish, outside off, and he shoulders arms
fullish length, and he drops this towards point. They set off and complete a quick single before backward point can get to this
length, dropped with soft hands towards point and they pinch another quick single
short, and he leans back and pulls this wide of mid-on. They will pick up two
fullish, worked with the turn towards square leg
full, but down the leg side, and he plays a fine sweep. Just falling over a touch, but he knew where he was hitting. Just uses the pace of the ball
fullish length, driven towards long-on
presses forward to defend one around off
fuller, around leg, and he can ease this towards square leg
defends with a forward press
skips down the wicket, and Cornwall throws it wide. He's lofted this inside out, and there's a deep cover in place. It doesn't carry to Kyle Mayers, though
length, worked with the angel coming in towards short mid-wicket. They pinch another single
length, presses forward to defend one around off
down the wicket, and lofted this well through the long-on region. No fielder in the deep, so that makes it a safe shot right here

that could be close? It's fired in quick, and Tamim plays off the back foot. Struck on the pad, as he shapes to flick. Not given, but West Indies review this. It's probably just going down leg, or might stay umpire's call, looking at the fact that it was speared in flat. Doesn't straighten enough, I think. The West Indies players weren't too sure, themselves. It is close to the bat, but goes pas the stumps. And it stays on umpire's call!
length, goes back to defend
good length, outside off and turning into the stumps. Fended towards midwicket
full just outside off stump. Driven to long on. Throw from Mayers at long on hits Tamim on the arm. He's fine
full, on off. Tamim presses forward, down on one knee, exposing middle and leg stump. Plays a sweep, very fine for four and that's Bangladesh's first first-wicket stand of 50+ in 14 innings
full on middle and leg. Pushed towards the bowler
full on middle. Nudges it off his toes to the leg side
full on middle. Turning past leg stump, but Tamim plays the reverse sweep! Point going to leg slip leaves a gap on the off side, and Tamim punishes West Indies for it
full outside off. Turning away as he pokes at it. Past the edge
full on off. Turning away, and turned to midwicket. They want a single, but eventually choose not to
good length, on middle. Fended off the back foot
good length, outside off stump. Rocks back and plays an exquisite cut to the point boundary. This is some strategy!

taken? West Indies think it's out. Sarkar has not moved. Umpire does not raise his finger. West Indies review This was an overpitched ball outside off. Sarkar tries to cut. Takes an edge, hits the keeper's gloves, ball pops up in the air, and first slip - Cornwall - dives forward to hold on! This time Illingworth gets it wrong. For what it's worth, Sarkar started to walk as soon as WI reviewed. He knew he had nicked, but it's also his right to stay put if the on-field umpire hasn't given him out. Fair play from all parties. Also the introduction of the part-timer, the captain himself, works
full on middle and off. Defended back to Brathwaite
drifts in, this full toss on middle and leg. Knocked back to Brathwaite, who has a shy at the stumps at the batsman's end since Shanto was hovering just outside
full, just outside off stump. Defended towards the off side
full, outside off. Caresses a drive to cover
full on middle and leg. Defended
full, on middle.  Defended
good length, on middle. Punched to long on
full, on middle and leg. Defended towards the leg side
good length on off. Turning in. Flicked off his pads to square leg
full on off. He takes a big stride forward, defending with a low centre of gravity
full, on middle. Skips down the ground, and whips it off his toes to the gap near deep midwicket. Man at long on runs to his left to cut it off, and despite a big chase he can't get to it
full, just outside off stump. Defended towards the off side
full, just outside off. Caresses a drive, and the bowler runs to his right to stop the one
full outside off stump. Defended, after lunging forward
full on off stump. Drives hard to midwicket, but the fielder stops, parries it away. The bowler then runs across to ensure they can't take the one
full, wide, and punished! Enough room to free his arms, and he cracks a shot wide enough for long off to have no chance
full, on off stump. Blocked off the front foot
full just outside off. Drives this uppishly, but in the gap past the bowler to long on. His 28th Test fifty
full, on middle. Defended
blocks it again
good length, on off. Goes deep, and blocks off the back foot towards the off side
full, on middle. Giant stride forward, and defended
full, just outside off. Turning a bit away, and he plays with soft hands to the off side
full, just outside off. Driven to cover, but can't pin the gap

golden arm! And Tamim falls after another good, brisk innings. Both openers fall to the part-timer. Full, just outside off. Tamim attempts the drive. Checks it slightly actually, and it goes straight to short cover, placed there for that very shot!
full outside off. Driven with the turn towards cover. Fielder runs to his right, dives and locks the ball in his palm
good length, just outside off. Skidding in. Fended off the back foot
full, wider. Drilled, past cover. Protection in the deep though
good length, outside off. Flays a cut, and it's edged to the third-man region for four!
fullish, just outside off stump. Left alone
full, outside off. Lunges forward, covering his stumps, and then shoulders his arms
fullish, on off stump. Defended towards the off side
good length, outside off. Cut to deep point
full on middle. Defended, off the front foot, with soft hands
full, on off stump. Defended, back to the bowler
good length ball on off. Angling in, and he goes onto the back foot. Plays it late, and it nearly hits his pads before getting the bat across to flick
full, on off. Onto the back foot, shuffling across, and defended
good length, outside off. Cuts for the width to the fielder at point
full, on off stump. Defended towards cover
full, just outside off. Check-drives towards short cover
tossed up, wide outside off. Big stride forward, and fended away
good length, outside off. Some extra bounce, and he cuts. In the air, but short of point
full, on off. Defended, and inside-edged onto his pads
good length, just outside off stump. Goes onto the back foot, and fends it away to point
full on middle and leg. Defends off the front foot towards the leg side
good length, outside off. Cut off the back foot. To point again
full, on off stump. Defended towards short cover. Maiden over
length ball just outside off. He shuffles across to the leg side and then flays a cut to the off
full, just outside off. Tries to drive, but toe-ends it between the bowler and short cover
full, just outside off. Check-driven to the off side
full on off stump. Defended off the front foot
extra air, full just outside off. Caresses a drive past short cover to long off
pushes at this ball to point
full, on off. Blocked
full, just outside off stump. Defended to the off side

good length, on middle and leg. Tries to flick, and it's a soft catch to short leg! Moseley under the helmet. Hugs for the fielder for that reflex catch and Shanto's torrid series ends with a 31-ball 11

fuller, around leg, and driven towards long-on

this goes on with the arm, and nearly sneaks through his defence. Mominul goes back, looking to cut it on length, and then it jams in and takes the inside edge. Drops near off stump
worked with the incoming angle towards square leg. Quick single pinched
length, goes back and works it towards long leg

outside off, presses forward to defend

defends from the crease

is that the breakthrough? He's got one to rip across him, and Da Silva picks it up and exults. Given out, but Rahim has reviewed. Seems like the bat has taken the edge, if you ask me. The bat then goes on to hit the ground, but before that, there appears to be a decent deviation. Great bowling from Warrican. The spike is there, and what an inspired bowling change this has proved to be!

down the wicket, and taken it with the turn. Doesn't bother to keep it down, and swings this through the mid-wicket region for six

length, spins across from leg and beyond. Good collection by Da Silva

sharp turn, and that has taken off from a length, and gone straight to leg slip! Mithun drags himself off from the crease. There's bounce again from Cornwall and that's what foxes Mithun. Not a long he did wrong, but perhaps didn't account for the sharp bite across this ball. West Indies must be feeling a sniff of a historic victory now

Hits his front leg and lbw given. Nayeem will survive this dismissal only if it pitched outside leg, but it doesn't. Pitched on leg, hits on middle, and crashing into off. West Indies need 1 wicket to win
